solution_line_template: Santana has {brothers_october} + {brothers_november} + {brothers_december} = <<{brothers_october}+{brothers_november}+{brothers_december}={brothers_second_half}>>{brothers_second_half} brothers with birthdays in the second half of the year.

She has {total_brothers} brothers - {brothers_second_half} brothers = <<{total_brothers}-{brothers_second_half}={brothers_first_half}>>{brothers_first_half} brothers with birthdays in the first half of the year.

Altogether, she has to buy {brothers_second_half} + {total_brothers} = <<{brothers_second_half}+{total_brothers}={presents_second_half}>>{presents_second_half} presents in the second half of the year.
Therefore, she has to buy {presents_second_half} - {brothers_first_half} = <<{presents_second_half}-{brothers_first_half}={difference}>>{difference} more presents in the second half of the year.
